19pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom"&gt;&lt;span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Helvetica',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%"&gt;Total fair value&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="background-color:#efefef;border-bottom:3pt double #000000;border-top:1pt solid #000;padding:2px 0 2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom"&gt;&lt;span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Helvetica',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%"&gt;$&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="background-color:#efefef;border-bottom:3pt double #000000;border-top:1pt solid #000;padding:2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"&gt;&lt;span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Helvetica',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%"&gt;99,475&#160;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="background-color:#efefef;border-bottom:3pt double #000000;border-top:1pt solid #000;padding:2px 1pt 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="margin-top:18pt;text-align:justify"&gt;&lt;span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Helvetica',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%"&gt;Derivative Instruments and Hedging&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"&gt;&lt;span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Helvetica',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"&gt;The Company may use derivative instruments to partially offset its business exposure to foreign exchange and interest rate risk. However, the Company may choose not to hedge certain exposures for a variety of reasons, including accounting considerations or the prohibitive economic cost of hedging particular exposures. There can be no assurance the hedges will offset more than a portion of the financial impact resulting from movements in foreign exchange or interest rates.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="margin-top:18pt;text-align:justify"&gt;&lt;span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Helvetica',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"&gt;Foreign Exchange Rate Risk&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"&gt;&lt;span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Helvetica',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"&gt;To protect gross margins from fluctuations in foreign exchange rates, the Company may use forwards, options or other instruments, and may designate these instruments as cash flow hedges. The Company generally hedges portions of its forecasted foreign currency exposure associated with revenue and inventory purchases, typically for up to 12 months.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"&gt;&lt;span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Helvetica',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"&gt;To protect the Company&#x2019;s foreign currency&#x2013;denominated term debt or marketable securities from fluctuations in foreign exchange rates, the Company may use forwards, cross-currency swaps or other instruments. The Company designates these instruments as either cash flow or fair value hedges. As of December&#160;30, 2023, the maximum length of time over which the Company is hedging its exposure to the variability in future cash flows for term debt&#x2013;related foreign currency transactions is 19 years.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"&gt;&lt;span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Helvetica',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"&gt;The Company may also use derivative instruments that are not designated as accounting hedges to protect gross margins from certain fluctuations in foreign exchange rates, as well as to offset a portion of the foreign currency gains and losses generated by the remeasurement of certain assets and liabilities denominated in non-functional currencies.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="margin-top:18pt;text-align:justify"&gt;&lt;span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Helvetica',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"&gt;Interest Rate Risk&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"&gt;&lt;span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Helvetica',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"&gt;To protect the Company&#x2019;s term debt or marketable securities from fluctuations in interest rates, the Company may use interest rate swaps, options or other instruments. The Company designates these instruments as either cash flow or fair value hedges.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="margin-top:18pt;text-align:justify"&gt;&lt;span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Helvetica',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"&gt;The notional amounts of the Company&#x2019;s outstanding derivative instruments as of December&#160;30, 2023 and September&#160;30, 2023 were as follows (in millions):&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="margin-top:3pt;text-align:justify"&gt;&lt;table Receivable&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"&gt;&lt;span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Helvetica',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"&gt;Trade Receivables&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"&gt;&lt;span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Helvetica',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"&gt;The Company&#x2019;s third-party cellular network carriers accounted for 34% and 41% of total trade receivables as of December&#160;30, 2023 and September&#160;30, 2023, respectively. The Company requires third-party credit support or collateral from certain customers to limit credit risk.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="margin-top:18pt;text-align:justify"&gt;&lt;span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Helvetica',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"&gt;Vendor Non-Trade Receivables&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"&gt;&lt;span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Helvetica',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"&gt;The Company has non-trade receivables from certain of its manufacturing vendors resulting from the sale of components to these vendors who manufacture subassemblies or assemble final products for the Company. The Company purchases these components directly from suppliers. The Company does not reflect the sale of these components in products net sales. Rather, the Company recognizes any gain on these sales as a reduction of products cost of sales when the related final products are sold by the Company. As of December&#160;30, 2023, the Company had two vendors that individually represented 10% or more of total vendor non-trade receivables, which accounted for 50% and 20%&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#000000;font-family:'Helvetica',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"&gt;.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Helvetica',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"&gt; As of September&#160;30, 2023, the Company had two vendors that individually represented 10% or more of total vendor non-trade receivables, which accounted for 48% and 23%.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</us-gaap:FinancialInstrumentsDisclosureTextBlock>

The Company uses net proceeds from the commercial paper program for general corporate purposes, including dividends and share repurchases. As of December&#160;30, 2023 and September&#160;30, 2023, the Company had $2.0 billion and $6.0 billion of commercial paper outstanding, respectively. The Company&#x2019;s share repurchase program does not obligate the Company to acquire a minimum amount of shares. Under the program, shares may be repurchased in privately negotiated or open market transactions, including under plans complying with Rule 10b5-1 under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the &#x201c;Exchange Act&#x201d;).&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</us-gaap:StockholdersEquityNoteDisclosureTextBlock>

    <ecd:MtrlTermsOfTrdArrTextBlock contextRef="c-117" id="f-616">&lt;div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"&gt;&lt;span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Helvetica',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"&gt;On November 11, 2023 and November 27, 2023, respectively, Luca Maestri, the Company&#x2019;s Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, and Katherine L. Adams, the Company&#x2019;s Senior Vice President and General Counsel, each entered into a trading plan intended to satisfy the affirmative defense conditions of Rule 10b5-1(c) under the Exchange Act. The plans provide for the sale of all shares vested during the duration of the plans pursuant to certain equity awards granted to Mr. Maestri and Ms. Adams, respectively, excluding any shares withheld by the Company to satisfy income tax withholding and remittance obligations. Mr. Maestri&#x2019;s plan will expire on December 31, 2024, and Ms. Adams&#x2019;s plan will expire on November 1, 2024, subject to early termination for certain specified events set forth in the plans.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</ecd:MtrlTermsOfTrdArrTextBlock>
    <ecd:MtrlTermsOfTrdArrTextBlock contextRef="c-116" id="f-615">&lt;div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"&gt;&lt;span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Helvetica',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"&gt;On November 11, 2023 and November 27, 2023, respectively, Luca Maestri, the Company&#x2019;s Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, and Katherine L. Adams, the Company&#x2019;s Senior Vice President and General Counsel, each entered into a trading plan intended to satisfy the affirmative defense conditions of Rule 10b5-1(c) under the Exchange Act. The plans provide for the sale of all shares vested during the duration of the plans pursuant to certain equity awards granted to Mr. Maestri and Ms. Adams, respectively, excluding any shares withheld by the Company to satisfy income tax withholding and remittance obligations. Mr. Maestri&#x2019;s plan will expire on December 31, 2024, and Ms. Adams&#x2019;s plan will expire on November 1, 2024, subject to early termination for certain specified events set forth in the plans.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</ecd:MtrlTermsOfTrdArrTextBlock>
